original_title:
The Texas Legislature will now move toward eliminating PROPERTY TAXES, according to State Rep. Brian Harrison.

Get it done, and do it in every state.
  — The Donald
article_summary: Texas Legislature plans to eliminate property taxes, sparking debate over property rights and the role of government in taxation. Critics argue that property taxes amount to theft and negatively impact homeowners, particularly those who rent their property from the government. Some propose charging the federal government taxes for holding land within states, or using property tax funds to rebate state landowners. The conversation also touches on the potential impact on education systems and the perceived predatory nature of property taxes.</s>
